content: The app does not work fully. It is not updated for newer Android phones and there is no upgrade. I reinstalled it and it still will not show me any illustrations or videos, only blank screens. Also, the app wants access to your contacts and media which I do not understand. This app should not be asking for your contacts. I'm glad I didn't spend more on this or would have pursued a refund.
replyContent: I believe we responded 5/4, here again: The simple fix (just like rebooting a computer) is to de-install then reinstall  when you have a good strong internet connection - if you downloaded it when your connection was weak or spotty this can sometimes affect the graphics.  Please try that.  If it doesn’t work, we will need to troubleshoot more.

content: A lot more information than I expected, which is fantastic. Easy to use and find what you are looking for. There are several subjects still being worked on, but they are really only helpful to a vet, not the layman.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! And, yes - you nailed it!  We are completing the most common/urgent records first and then the more complex/esoteric records later.  Take good care. - The HSVG Team

content: This is by far the best app for horse people. While it is a little confusing at first with the many choices, just start exploring the options. You will soon figure it out. The graphics are amazing and help me understand so much more about my horse's body parts. I wish there were a printed book with these images. I would love to just sit and study the images. There are also lots of videos to show you how to do different things. This is so valuable since sometimes pictures or written descriptions can't explain it effectively. Thanks for making such a cool app.
Best app ever for quality information at your fingers when you need it. The pictures are excellent to show details of the horse's bone structure, etc.
Conditions well covered and easily understood. Don't see how to improve something this Good!..
Good basic equine vet app for all horse owners.
Too hard to use and cannot cancel.
replyContent: Hi Pamela, for the moment HSVG is a one-time fee of $5.00 so there is no need to cancel an ongoing subscription. And I believe we may have corresponded via email regarding the issue you were looking for.  Sorry you found HSVG hard to use, we will consider your feedback in our next update. Best wishes - the HSVG Team

content: It's brilliant to know it is not here to rip you off as majority do but be careful it is a good help great
User friendly and very well explained.

I am a veterinarian in the process of ECFVG certification  program in the US. I can't hide my excitement from finding this gem. Kudos to the team. Keep it up team! You are freaking amazing! Refund? Are you kidding me? I owe you a big donation as soon as I pass my exams and get my very first paycheck as a certified veterinarian in the United States.
replyContent: Hi Saeid, We are so glad HSVG is of help to you. Best wishes in your career here in the US!  Once you get on your feet, please feel free to look up our vet practice - Thal Equine in Santa Fe NM. Would love to meet you. - Dr. Doug Thal of HSVG

content: "These people are hard working and passionate about horses. If you can't find the information you are looking for, I can tell you, that, these people can help you! This is a GREAT on the go app!  "
replyContent: Wow - thank you so much for your kind words. Best wishes to you and your horses! - The HSVG Team

content: Every horse owner should have this app, it's packed with info and new info is periodically added! Love it!
replyContent: Thanks for your stellar review, much appreciated. And, yes, we keep adding more information day-to-day, so HSVG should only become more valuable to you over time. Cheers! - The HSVG Team

content: Can't even begin to explain how much I love this app♡
replyContent: Thank you Alessandra!  Please tell your friends about HSVG!

content: Great app very handy to have
replyContent: Thank you, thank you for your kind review!  We hope you find HSVG useful!

content: This is a great guide.  It's practical, sensible, and, so far as I can tell, accurate.  The author is a veterinarian.  It's as good or better than most printed reference works on horse health and first aid.
replyContent: Wow - thank you Donna.  HSVG was a challenge to make, but it keeps getting better as we add more content to it over time.  Take good care - Dr. Thal & the HSVG Team

content: This app is useful whether you have one horse or manage a barn. It's packed with easy to understand information on horse care, illness, injury, worming, first aid supplies, etc. Very comprehensive. Treat yourself or call the vet? This app helps you make that determination.
replyContent: Yowzers - thank you for your kind words! Note - we keep adding content to HSVG over time and look forward to making it even more comprehensive (and valuable) to all horse owners.

content: Fast answers to most urgent questions and points me in the right direction as to whether I need a vet immediately or if I can manage without.
replyContent: Thanks for your insightful comment and review! We do try to distinguish between circumstances you might be able manage yourself and when you need to call your vet.  Regardless, we strongly encourage good communication between horse owners and their local vet - for the good of your horse!

content: Best app ever
replyContent: Wow - thank you! We plan on adding more content this fall and winter. And we have some exciting updates we are working on...  HSVG is only going to get better and more valuable to you over time.  Take Care!

content: Used as a guide and learned things as well. Great for a refresher as well.

I love this app...very informative...great information and lots of it. There has been several times ive had friends ask me about something thats wrong or just in general  with their horse....if i didnt know i looked it up....if i did know....it helps back up my explanation......i love it...easy to use and look  up things....great job!!!!...great app!!!! Well worth the purchase!!!!

This app has lots of great info, some general , some very specific.  Its easy to use, I've only had it a week and I've looked up lots of interesting things.  Obviously it does not replace a vet, but has good information and is presented in an easy to use format.  I like the option to keep specifics about your horse and how to do general horse health checks.  Really glad I got this app!
replyContent: Hi Debbie, thank you for your kind review, it is much appreciated!

content: So, I know now that I should have read the fine print.  after buying and installing your app, I wanted to see how to find the pulse on the leg... no pics. finally figure out the only pics you have or any media is a pic of the eye that you use on your advertisement on the app store, a pic of the sole of the food and a bump on a leg (not a good pic either). It says you will get this up and running on the app sometime. well I paid for it, I want it... I don't understand why a smart phone app doesn't have the same videos and pictures on your website. It's a smart phone for goodness sakes. I'd have been better off just looking at the website on my phone, OHHHH but I got the app so I would have the info at my fingertips INSIDE the barn that doesn't get good enough connection to the cell phone towers to view websites...... NOT A HAPPY CUSTOMER AND LEAVING THIS AS A NOT SO NICE REVIEW TOO! Does it have good info in print form, sorta, if the person can read through it all, understand it when under pressure and is good at visualizing instructions, which not everyone is good at.
replyContent: I responded to your email, where I had more room to explain why some media requires an internet connection & some does not.  There are 21 videos & 16 images in Quick Reference & a related written skill "Assess Heat & Digital Pulse in Feet" all of which are available without an Internet connection. - Hope this explanation helps.

content: I've only had this app installed about a week and a half and its already paid for itself.  Every horse owner regardless of experience should have it.
Love it!
I like having so much info at my fingertips . A quick reference when the Vet or Farrier come .

Great resource for anyone interested in the care of a horse's health as well as many equine medical issues.  Lots of helpful and detailed anatomical charts, skills/procedure videos, and educational text to help increase your skills.
replyContent: Thank you for your kind review!

content: It's a great way to learn the new techniques in medical terms of the horse and the parts of the horse and how they work and how you can improve your riding  skills whether it's dressage  hunter jumper or barrel racing
replyContent: Hi Aaron - thank you for your kind review! And, yes, HSVG is intended for all horse owners and equestrian professionals regardless of discipline.

content: It stops all the time and have reported it but nothing has been done to fix the problem not worth the money for something you can never use
replyContent: Hi Jessica, We just uploaded update 2.1.3 with a few fixes. We suggest that you delete & reinstall the app in a place where you have a good strong Internet connection - and then try it out again.  If you continue to have trouble please email us at comments@horsesidevetguide.com and we can troubleshoot some more.  Thanks -The HSVG Team

content: Finally figured out how to download this (I'm app challenged!) and so glad I did!
replyContent: Hi Cindy, Thanks for your perseverance!  The good news is that it is available to you in rural areas without wifi.  The GREAT news is that when you do have wifi, you can update it with the latest information.  We are constantly adding to and improving HSVG.

content: Easy to navigate; can search by diagnoses, clinical observations and more. Helpful picture links to keep all things equine straight in your head!
replyContent: Thans Natalie!

content: 4 stars, 5 if it had a place to keep your own horses' info, like baseline vitals so you know where to start, if you think something is wrong.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! There are many horse record-keeping apps out there. However, that type of app has proven to be difficult to make. We applaud the developers that have tried. Regarding "where to start" - please look at our WHOLE HORSE EXAM Skill, Video & related Form: http://horsesidevetguide.com/the-whole-horse-exam         Hope this helps!

content: It keeps crashing
replyContent: Hi Collen, We just uploaded update 2.1.3 with a few fixes. You suggest that you delete & reinstall the app in a place where you have a good strong Internet connection - and then try it out again.  If you continue to have trouble please email us at comments@horsesidevetguide.com and we can troubleshoot some more.  Thank -The  HSVG Team

content: Not enough internal data on my phone. Can't install to sd card unless i delete apps to install and THEN transfer.
replyContent: Hi Ellen, Sorry about the memory issue on your device. HSVG is packed with info, and it keeps growing. You must seek a refund via your Google Play acct.  Note, we made the same info available FREE on our website HorseSideVetGuide.com - please take a look.  It's the best “plan b” we could create for situations like yours. - Sincerely the HSVG Team

content: New update crashes...please fix. Would like to use this app, especially after having to paying the $4.00 or $5.00...thank you.
replyContent: Lourie - FIXED!  Please update or reinstall the app and you should be good to go!  Sorry for the trouble and thanks for inadvertently testing the latest build.   :)

content: Love this its great
Very thorough source for all things related to horse health
replyContent: Thank you for your kind review!  Although we admit, its not finished...  We are constantly adding more equine health info to the app based on current developments in equine health and user requests.  The app should only become more valuable to you over time.  Best wishes - The HSVG Team

content: Very easy to use and invaluable information
replyContent: Hi Mary, We appreciate your rating and review - thank you!  We worked very had to make the app user friendly and we have some great updates planned for the future.  Best wishes - The HSVG Team

content: I use this app all the time!  I especially love the media section, with diagrams, pictures, and videos.  I would recommend it for anyone entrusted with the care of horses!
replyContent: Hi Cathy, We hope you don't need our app that often :)  Thank you for the nice review, it is much appreciated.  HSVG was, and remains, a labor of love for us.  We regularly add more information and have some fun updates planned for the future.  Take good care - The HSVG Team

content: Some of the videos don't work and saying that he does not believe in using food to catch a horse is unhelpful. Positive reinforcement training techniques are used by modern animal trainers all over the world with great success. Positive reinforcement is not only about training but about changing emotions towards training. Many zoos train their animals to accept medical procedures without the need for sedation this way. There is no reason why horses can not be trained the same way.
replyContent: We fixed the video issue (we think!) in Version 2.0.  Please email us with any problems. You need not agree w/ my approach to horse handling. However, as a life-long horseman & equine vet w/ 20+ years of experience, if I had to use food to accomplish something with a horse, I couldn't do my job. I am open to talking to you further. Dr. Thal

content: Kudos to the developers of this app! Fantastic tool for horse lovers to use with their veterinary teams. The interlinked and relational database, with graphics and additional resources, is wonderful! I'm learning so much about the skills I need to help provide the best care for my horse. A lot of thought, research, and energy went into making this app work so well. Thank you!
replyContent: Wow thanks! It was a challenge to make so we GREATLY appreciate your review!  Note, we constantly add content so synch often (button in upper right corner of home screen) HSVG will only increase in value over time.  We also have some exciting things in the works - so p/s like us on FB or sign up for our email newsletter at HorseSideVetGuide.com :)

content: Excellent app.
Awesome tool to have on hand
So far my favorite horse app. Only thing that would make it perfect would be a section to log care for each horse....worming, teeth, farrier, shots, vet visits, etc.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Note, there are many horse record-keeping apps already available. However, as you can see from their mixed reviews, that type of app has proven to be difficult to make. We applaud the developers that have tried. Given our focus, we added the notes section linked to a single record, not a single horse. We hope that is helpful.

content: Wonderful app!

I am a worry wart when it comes to my pets of all kinds.  HSVG gives me the comfort of not being in the dark and knowing what to do.  I highly recommend this to all horse owners.  Its intuitive, intelligent and very simple.  The content is extensive and extreamely detailed.  Bravo Dr. Thal!

Had this app on my iPad since it came out. Just got the Android version for my phone. It's just as awesome!  It's a must-have when caring for horses. Love the way how I can go from Observations to extensive lists of possible causes to check on or search. You don't need to know the medical terms for finding what you need: Searching "watery eye" will give me results for teary, running, draining as well due to a vast number of cross reference keywords.   It's not a static app you buy and are stuck with--this thriving knowledge base for all parts of horse health that grows almost daily. Beats the heck out of "Dr. Google" because the info is reviewed by a vet and reliable as well as complete.    You don’t need a high speed internet connection for reviewing the information and videos once you've installed it, so it’s always ready even when you're out and about. Run a sync to get the new content when you have a signal. It allows you to see directly which articles were added or updated. Very nice indeed.   This app truly shows how much thought and care went into its design and it is remarkably free of bugs. In months of use I've not run into problems.

For the price of a coffee, now I can look up my horse's symptoms right when I see them. This app has everything - videos, diagnostic tools, diagrams, how-to guides and so much more. I bought it on my iPad and use it so much I bought it for my android phone. I'm now the go to person for my friends when they have any equine questions, it's the best $5 I've ever spent.
